com.informatica.presales.sources.informix.cdc

Class InformixReaderThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.informatica.presales.sources.informix.cdc.InformixReaderThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

     class InformixReaderThread
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Author:
    pyoung InformixReaderThread creates a separate thread to receive data from the CDC API. The data is formatted as CSV and placed in the event queue to be picked up by main plug-in thread.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Run entry point of the CDCReader Thread object.

        Loops through the data sent from Informix CDC API, extracts the header data, and calls the handler for each record type.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • processRecBeginTX

        int processRecBeginTX(java.io.DataInputStream dis,
                    int bytesProcessed,
                    java.lang.String outStr)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Processes a Begin Transaction message from CDC API.

        First, makes sure the transaction ID does not already exist in the transaction map. Starts a new transaction list inside m_TransactionMap.

        If STANDALONE_MODE is true, generates an CSV representation which will be shown in the debug output. Otherwise, no output is generated.

        Parameters:
        dis - DataInputStream - the input stream
        bytesProcessed - - The number of bytes already processed in the input stream
        outStr - - Output String
        Returns:
        bytesProcessed - the number of bytes consumed in the
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • processRecCommitTX

        int processRecCommitTX(java.io.DataInputStream dis,
                     int bytesProcessed,
                     java.lang.String outStr)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Processes a Commit Transaction message from CDC API.

        First, makes sure the transaction ID already exists in the transaction map. Send each individual operation onto m_EventQueue to be picked up by the main plug-in thread. Remove operations from the list for this transaction

        If STANDALONE_MODE is true, generates an XML representation which will be shown in the debug output. Otherwise, no output is generated.

        Parameters:
        dis - DataInputStream - the input stream
        bytesProcessed - - The number of bytes already processed in the input stream
        outStr - - Output String
        Returns:
        bytesProcessed - the number of bytes consumed in this method
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • processRecRollbackTX

        int processRecRollbackTX(java.io.DataInputStream dis,
                       int bytesProcessed,
                       java.lang.String outStr)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Processes a Rollback Transaction message from CDC API.

        First, makes sure the transaction ID already exists in the transaction map. Remove operations from the list for this transaction.

        If STANDALONE_MODE is true, generates an XML representation which will be shown in the debug output.

        Parameters:
        dis - DataInputStream - the input stream
        bytesProcessed - - The number of bytes already processed in the input stream
        outStr - - Output String
        Returns:
        bytesProcessed - the number of bytes consumed in this method
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • processRecIUD

        int processRecIUD(java.io.DataInputStream dis,
                int bytesProcessed,
                int payloadSize,
                int recordNumber,
                java.lang.String outStr)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Process a change record from the CDC API This handles the Insert, Update, and Delete operations.

        First, verify that the transaction ID exists in the transaction map (m_TransactionMap). For an update operation, we will receive both an update-before and an update-after record. The update before is discarded. All other transactions are parsed and the individual fields are added to the "body" section in the output XML.

        The resulting XML string is placed in the m_TransactionMap

        Parameters:
        dis - DataInputStream - the input stream
        bytesProcessed - - The number of bytes already processed in the input stream
        outStr - - Output String
        Returns:
        bytesProcessed - the number of bytes consumed in this method
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • processRecTabSchema

        int processRecTabSchema(java.io.DataInputStream dis,
                      int bytesProcessed,
                      int payloadSize,
                      java.lang.String outStr)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Process the table schema returned at the start of each session

        The table schema is returned as a comma separated list of field names and field types.

        Parameters:
        dis - DataInputStream - the input stream
        bytesProcessed - - The number of bytes already processed in the input stream
        outStr - - Output String
        Returns:
        bytesProcessed - the number of bytes consumed in this method
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String host,
           int port,
           java.lang.String database,
           java.lang.String iServer,
           java.lang.String user,
           java.lang.String pswd)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Create the JDBC connection to the Informix Database and retrieve the error codes and record types
        Parameters:
        host - - Hostname of the database server
        port - - TCP port for JDBC connection
        database - - Database name (e.g. syscdcv1)
        iServer - - Informix server name (e.g. ol_informix1170)
        user - - Informix Login username (e.g. informix)
        pswd - - Informix Login password
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
